name: George Washington
fact: George Washington had wooden teeth, although they weren't actually made of wood. They were made of materials such as ivory, gold, and lead.

name: John Adams
fact: John Adams was the first president to live in the White House, although it wasn't fully completed during his tenure.

name: Thomas Jefferson
fact: Thomas Jefferson was an avid inventor and is credited with inventing many things, including the swivel chair and the pedometer.

name: James Madison
fact: James Madison was the shortest U.S. president, standing at only 5 feet 4 inches tall.

name: James Monroe
fact: James Monroe's presidency was known as the "Era of Good Feelings" due to a period of national unity and prosperity.

name: John Quincy Adams
fact: John Quincy Adams enjoyed skinny-dipping in the Potomac River every morning, even during the winter.

name: Andrew Jackson
fact: Andrew Jackson had a pet parrot named Poll that he taught to curse like a sailor.

name: Martin Van Buren
fact: Martin Van Buren was the first president born as a United States citizen, as all previous presidents were born before the country's independence.

name: William Henry Harrison
fact: William Henry Harrison gave the longest inauguration speech in history, which lasted nearly two hours, on a cold, rainy day. He caught pneumonia and died a month later.

name: John Tyler
fact: John Tyler was the first vice president to succeed to the presidency due to the death of a president. He was also the first president to get married while in office.

name: James K. Polk
fact: James K. Polk was the first president to have his photograph taken while in office.

name: Zachary Taylor
fact: Zachary Taylor died just 16 months into his presidency, making his tenure the second shortest in U.S. history.

name: Millard Fillmore
fact: Millard Fillmore installed the first bathtub in the White House, although this claim is widely disputed.

name: Franklin Pierce
fact: Franklin Pierce was arrested for running over an old woman with his horse. The charges were later dropped due to lack of evidence.

name: James Buchanan
fact: James Buchanan is the only president who never married. His niece, Harriet Lane, served as the official White House hostess during his presidency.

name: Abraham Lincoln
fact: Abraham Lincoln is the only president to have obtained a patent for an invention. He patented a device to lift boats over shoals and obstructions in a river.

name: Andrew Johnson
fact: Andrew Johnson was the first president to be impeached by the House of Representatives, although he was acquitted by the Senate by just one vote.

name: Ulysses S. Grant
fact: Ulysses S. Grant was given a ticket for riding his horse too fast in Washington, D.C., which he promptly paid.

name: Rutherford B. Hayes
fact: Rutherford B. Hayes was the first president to use a telephone in the White House.

name: James A. Garfield
fact: James A. Garfield could write Latin with one hand and Greek with the other, simultaneously.

name: Chester A. Arthur
fact: Chester A. Arthur owned 80 pairs of pants, each of which was custom-made and had his initials sewn into the waistband.

name: Grover Cleveland (Term 1)
fact: Grover Cleveland is the only president to serve two non-consecutive terms, making him both the 22nd and 24th president.

name: Benjamin Harrison
fact: Benjamin Harrison was the first president to have electricity in the White House, although he was afraid to touch the light switches himself.

name: Grover Cleveland (Term 2)
fact: Grover Cleveland underwent secret surgery to remove a tumor from his mouth, which was performed aboard a yacht in the East River.

name: William McKinley
fact: William McKinley was the first president to ride in an automobile while in office.

name: Theodore Roosevelt
fact: Theodore Roosevelt was shot in the chest during a campaign speech, but the bullet was slowed by his thick speech manuscript and his eyeglasses case, saving his life.

name: William Howard Taft
fact: William Howard Taft was the heaviest president, weighing over 300 pounds. He once got stuck in the White House bathtub.

name: Woodrow Wilson
fact: Woodrow Wilson was the first president to hold a Ph.D. degree. He earned his doctorate in political science from Johns Hopkins University.

name: Warren G. Harding
fact: Warren G. Harding had a pet dog named Laddie Boy, who was often seen attending cabinet meetings and had his own chair.

name: Calvin Coolidge
fact: Calvin Coolidge enjoyed having his head rubbed with petroleum jelly while he ate breakfast in bed.

name: Herbert Hoover
fact: Herbert Hoover and his wife spoke fluent Chinese and would converse in Mandarin to prevent others from eavesdropping.

name: Franklin D. Roosevelt
fact: Franklin D. Roosevelt was related to 11 other U.S. presidents, including his distant cousin Theodore Roosevelt.

name: Harry S. Truman
fact: Harry S. Truman's middle initial "S" doesn't actually stand for anything; it was chosen to honor both of his grandfathers, Anderson Shipp Truman and Solomon Young.

name: Dwight D. Eisenhower
fact: Dwight D. Eisenhower loved playing golf and installed a putting green at the White House.

name: John F. Kennedy
fact: John F. Kennedy won a Pulitzer Prize for his book "Profiles in Courage," which he wrote while recuperating from back surgery.

name: Lyndon B. Johnson
fact: Lyndon B. Johnson had a pet beagle named Him. He once lifted Him by the ears for photographers, causing public outrage.

name: Richard Nixon
fact: Richard Nixon was a proficient pianist and even played for former Soviet Premier Nikita Khrushchev during a visit to the Soviet Union.

name: Gerald Ford
fact: Gerald Ford worked as a fashion model during his college years and appeared on the cover of Cosmopolitan magazine in 1942.

name: Jimmy Carter
fact: Jimmy Carter was the first U.S. president to be born in a hospital.

name: Ronald Reagan
fact: Ronald Reagan survived an assassination attempt in 1981 when he was shot by John Hinckley Jr. He recovered fully and even joked with the surgeons.

name: George H. W. Bush
fact: George H. W. Bush celebrated his 75th, 80th, 85th, and 90th birthdays by skydiving.

name: Bill Clinton
fact: Bill Clinton was once a saxophone-playing band member in high school. He even considered pursuing a career in music before choosing politics.

name: George W. Bush
fact: George W. Bush is the only U.S. president to have completed a marathon. He ran the Houston Marathon in 1993 with a time of 3 hours and 44 minutes.

name: Barack Obama
fact: Barack Obama collects Spider-Man and Conan the Barbarian comics. He even read Spider-Man comics during his younger days.

name: Donald Trump
fact: Donald Trump has appeared in several movies and TV shows, including cameos in Home Alone 2: Lost in New York and The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air.

name: Joe Biden
fact: Joe Biden overcame a stutter as a child and has become a strong advocate for people with disabilities.
